subject: Best Practices

children.description: In this module, learners will get an overview of the journey behind the design and implementation of mSeva in Punjab. The case of mSeva demonstrates why it is important for ULBs to build internal capacity before designing for citizens. mSeva stands as an exemplary model for building and stabilizing change management shifts at scale.

children.description: In this module, learners will get an overview of the journey behind the design and implementation of Seva Sindhu in Karnataka. The case of Seva Sindhu demonstrates how ULBs can design for universal access coverage in e-governance solutions rapidly and at scale. Seva Sindhu stands as an exemplary model for integrating all services under one platform.

children.description: In this module learners will get an overview of the journey behind the design and implementation of DigiThane in Maharashtra. The case of DigiThane demonstrates how ULBs can reimagine government-citizen engagement models with the use of right incentives and by involving citizen representatives. DigiThane stands as an exemplary model for designing demand-driven citizen engagement models for service delivery.

children.name: FINAL ASSESSMENT

content.name: Building Citizen-Centric E-Governance Solutions: Unveiling the Best Practices
content.description:
National Institute of Urban Affairs in partnership with Omidyar Network India and Treemouse has developed case studies highlighting the journey of award-winning e-governance solutions. The course presents best practices followed by ULBs in Maharashtra, Karnataka, Punjab, and Madhya Pradesh. The intent of the course is to highlight the journey of e-governance solutions right from conceptualization to implementation. The course focuses on the following key themes:
1/ Building internal capacity to develop e-governance solutions 
2/ Designing for universal access coverage of e-governance solutions
3/ Building scalable participatory citizen-centric approaches for e-governance solutions
4/ Reimagining the role of incentives to enhance uptake of e-governance solutions 

The course not only focuses on technical knowledge but provides the learners with actionable directions on how they can implement some of the strategies used by the award-winning ULBs. The learners will find bite-sized videos, toolkits that focus on how-to guides, and further reference material. 

We have designed this course for someone who is managing or leading a team of ULB officials or who is willing to explore how to drive change at ULBs. Learn from ULB officials who played a significant role right from the conceptualization to implementation of these award-winning e-governance initiatives. Join us to explore the impact stories of case studies highlighting best practices from ULBs in India. 

Thank you to all the teams and individuals who supported this initiative. We would like to acknowledge their contribution and offer special thanks:

Punjab Municipal Infrastructure Development Company (PMIDC)
- Smt. Isha Kalia, CEO, PMIDC
- Ms. Simarjeet Kaur, Program Manager, PMIDC
- Sh. Rahul Sharma, System Manager, PMIDC
- Sh. Gurpreet Khanna, Backend Developer, PMIDC
- Ms. Deepika Arora, Technical Lead, PMIDC

Thane Smart City, Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC)
- Sh. Sandeep Malvi, CEO, Thane Smart City
- Sh. Kailash Patil, Project Director, DigiThane
- Sh. Sudhir Gaikwad, Nodal Officer, Thane Smart City
- Sh. Praveen Papalkar, CTO, Thane Smart City

Directorate of Electronic Delivery of Citizen Services (EDCS)

- Sh. Anil Nayak, Project Manager, Seva Sindhu, EDCS
- Sh. Bhanu Prakash, Project Manager, K1 and B1, EDCS
- Sh. Anil Reddy, Project Manager, Janasevaka, EDCS

Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC):
